description: From Latin ambulatus, past participle of ambulō (“I walk, go about”). Doublet of amble.

verbs.description: ambulate (third-person singular simple present ambulates, present participle ambulating, simple past and past participle ambulated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To walk; to relocate oneself under the power of one's own legs.
examples: Peter slowly ambulated to the bathroom, favoring his strained knee.
